dialogue: ... On October 25th of last year, you lived on Old Quarry Road, correct?
Did you see anything unusual that evening?
I saw a man get out of his car in the middle of a storm.
Do you remember what time this was?
Twelve-forty-eight on the button. I looked at the clock. I heard thunder, so I went to the window. Lightning lit up the sky, and there he was.
He looked around. Then he went to the side of the road, peered over the railing, got back in his car and drove away.
Is the man you saw that night here in the courtroom today?
Yes. He is here today. That's him right there.
Let the record show the witness identified the man he saw as the defendant, James Michael Sythe.
Did they show you any other pictures?
Oh no, they knew it was him. They just wanted me to confirm it.
I was glad to help. Everyone was so grateful. And if I do say, it felt pretty good. To be needed again.
Right. Well, if there's anything else I can do, just give a holler. Tea's always hot.
James Sythe did kill that girl, right?
